name: Rich Harrison
description: '''Richard Christopher Harrison''' (born 1979) is an American record producer and songwriter specializing in [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] and [[hip hop music]]. The winner of a [[Grammy Award]], Harrison is well known for producing songs such as "[[Get Right]]" (performed by [[Jennifer Lopez]]), "[[1 Thing]]" (performed by [[Amerie]]) and "[[Crazy in Love]]" (performed by [[Beyonc√©]] and [[Jay-Z]]). Harrison is the founder of Richcraft Entertainment, a label that housed artists such as singer [[Amerie]], R&B girl group [[RichGirl]], and rapper [[Young Steff]].
